definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Love is a matter of how helpless, eye pain also wear in vain.
sentences.chinese: 爱是多么无奈的一件事，眼穿肠断也枉然。

definition: to scoop up water with the hands
lit. the mountains crumble and the trees lie ruined/a great sage has died (idiom)
cold pillow and lonely bed (idiom); fig. cold and solitary existence
sage Emperors Shun and Yao rule every day (idiom); all for the best in the best of all possible worlds
a beautiful dream is hard to realize (idiom)
as if degenerating into smoke (idiom); ignorant and unable to see where things are heading
to hurry forward on an expedition/to drive fast
to stand on tiptoe looking forward to sb or sth
